name: Delta Regional Authority
objective: The Delta Regional Authority (DRA) is a federal-state partnership serving a 240-county/parish area in an eight-state region. Led by a Federal Co-Chairman and the governors of each participating state, the DRA is designed to remedy severe and chronic economic distress by stimulating economic development and fostering partnerships that will have a positive impact on the region's economy. Help economically distressed communities to leverage other federal and state programs which are focused on basic infrastructure development, transportation improvements, business development, and job training services.
applicant_types: Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: Departments Of Labor, Health And Human Services, And Education, And Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001, 2000) as amended by H.R. 2646; The Farm Security And Rural Investment Act of 2002 (2002 Farm Bill).

rules_regulations: The Delta Regional Authority Code (limited distribution), The Communique an online journal devoted to the special problems and accomplishments of regional development. Annual Report.
